title: Policy Briefs and Recommendations
description: Writing clear, actionable policy documents for decision-makers

exercises.title: Policy Brief Structure
exercises.instruction: Learn the key components of an effective policy brief

components.name: Background/Context
components.purpose: Establish the problem and its significance

exercises.title: Writing Executive Summaries
exercises.instruction: Condense the following policy analysis into a 100-word executive summary

content.issue: The city faces a growing housing affordability crisis, with median home prices rising 45% over five years while wages increased only 12%.
options: Option A: Increase zoning density near transit stations
Option B: Expand rent control to more buildings
Option C: Provide subsidies for first-time homebuyers
content.recommendation: A combination of density increases and targeted subsidies

exercises.modelSummary: This brief recommends addressing the housing affordability crisis through increased zoning density near transit stations combined with targeted subsidies for first-time buyers earning below median income. With home prices rising 45% against 12% wage growth over five years, immediate action is necessary. While rent control offers short-term relief, evidence suggests it reduces housing supply long-term. The proposed approach balances market-based solutions with direct assistance, projected to create 5,000 new affordable units within three years while helping 2,000 families enter homeownership.

exercises.title: Language of Recommendations
exercises.instruction: Practice the verb forms and structures used in policy recommendations

exercises.scenario: You are certain this policy is necessary
exercises.weak: Maybe we could think about increasing funding.
exercises.improved: We strongly recommend increasing funding for early childhood education.

exercises.scenario: You want to present an option without strong advocacy
exercises.improved: One option worth considering is phased implementation over 18 months.

exercises.title: Integrating Evidence
exercises.instruction: Write a paragraph that integrates evidence to support a policy recommendation
exercises.topic: Recommend mandatory financial literacy education in high schools
evidence: Survey: Only 24% of adults can answer basic financial literacy questions correctly
Study: Students who took financial literacy courses had 15% lower credit card debt
International: Countries with mandatory financial education show higher savings rates
exercises.modelParagraph: The case for mandatory financial literacy education rests on substantial evidence. National surveys reveal a troubling knowledge gap: only 24 percent of adults can correctly answer basic questions about interest rates, inflation, and risk diversification. Crucially, research demonstrates that early intervention worksâ€”students who completed financial literacy courses accumulated 15 percent less credit card debt than their peers. International comparisons further support this approach: countries that have implemented mandatory financial education, including Australia and the Netherlands, consistently report higher household savings rates. Given this evidence, requiring financial literacy coursework in high schools represents a cost-effective investment in long-term economic well-being.
